marklogic.body:
With all due respect, Lamborn and Gardner are either stupid or lying. As a republican, I am sick and tired of having our elected republican officials continually propagating misinformation. At the start, it may be an honest error, but when they keep misstating the facts, eventually you have to conclude it's deliberate.
In December Off 2011, "The country exported 430,000 more barrels of gasoline a day than it imported in September, according to the U.S. Energy Information Administration. That is about twice the amount at the start of the year, and experts and industry insiders say the trend is here to stay." according to http://money.cnn.com/2011/12/05/news/economy/gasoline_export/index.htm
The price of gasoline in not determined by price fairies. If the oil companies can sell it for $8 a gallon in Europe, why should they sell it to local fools at half that? Get over it. As a consumer, your job is to Bleed into the coffers of the corporations. If you don't like it, quite buying from them.
